channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Officials Try to Reassure COP29 Climate Talks
item.description: Negotiators at the summit in Azerbaijan fear that the return of Donald Trump will sap momentum for global climate action.

item.title: Biden Officials Try to Reassure COP29 Climate Talks
item.description: Negotiators at the summit in Azerbaijan fear that the return of Donald Trump will sap momentum for global climate action.

item.title: Donald Trump warned not to pull out of Paris climate agreement—by the CEO of oil giant Exxon Mobil
item.description: A reversal of Biden's decision four years ago to return to the landmark U.N. climate agreement would create a harmful yo-yo effect for businesses that...

item.title: Leading China investor Fred Hu advises Beijing to ‘stay cool’ amid Trump tariff threat
item.description: If China retaliates to a trade war, "that’s a lose-lose with global ramifications,” said Primavera founder Fred Hu at the Fortune Global Forum.

item.title: Man Drives Car Into Crowd in Southern China, Killing at Least 35
item.description: The police in the city of Zhuhai detained a man who they said had rammed a small vehicle into people who were exercising at a sports center.

item.title: Exxon Chief to Trump: Don’t Withdraw From Paris Climate Deal
item.description: Darren Woods was one of only a few Western oil executives attending a global climate conference in Baku, Azerbaijan.

item.title: Exclusive: Ex-Netflix, Uber CMO Bozoma Saint John launches her own haircare and wig brand—with ‘a couple million’ of her own money
item.description: Saint John is known for building the brands of some of the world's most influential companies, now she's launching her own line.

item.title: Exclusive: The secretive Goldman Sachs pipeline that helps cash-poor founders tap into their vast wealth
item.description: Some of America's most successful founders are cash-poor and rely on personal liquidity loans to live lavish lifestyles.

item.title: Gary Lineker to Leave BBC’s ‘Match of the Day’
item.description: After a 26-year run, the voice of the broadcaster’s popular soccer highlights show will leave at the end of the 2025 season, the network said Tuesday.

item.title: Man Drives Car Into Crowd in Southern China, Killing at Least 35
item.description: The police in the city of Zhuhai detained a man who they said had rammed a small vehicle into people who were exercising at a sports center.

item.title: Why ‘Affordable Housing’ in New York City Can Still Cost $3,500 a Month
item.description: Soaring rents and few options have made it hard for average people to live in the city. Even “affordable” units often cost too much.

item.title: Married for 54 Years, Two Poll Workers Die in Election Day Flood
item.description: Chuck and Cathie Baldwin were caught in a flash flood as they drove to the polls. Known as “proud hippies,” they hosted a musical festival called Chuc...

item.title: Italian City in Amanda Knox Case Wants to Move On. A New Series Won’t Let It.
item.description: When a show produced by Ms. Knox about the murder of Meredith Kercher was filmed in Perugia, an outcry by residents led the mayor to apologize.

item.title: AT&T CEO: A looming airwave gap will bring higher cellphone bills
item.description: Wireless networks need electromagnetic spectrum—and a lot of it—to send data.

item.title: Exxon Chief to Trump: Don’t Withdraw From Paris Climate Deal
item.description: Darren Woods was one of only a few Western oil executives attending a global climate conference in Baku, Azerbaijan.
